intro: Nemepiodon caribeum, commonly known as the Caribbean orchid, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually broad and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers, which can be pink, white, or purple, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
